class.title: Prin Acct I
class.description: If enrolling in this course, you must have access to the Internet, e-mail and Microsoft Office software (97 or later version), including Word and Excel. Final exam must be taken at an approved monitored testing site. The MANDATORY orientation is online and must be completed by May 16. To complete the orientation, go to http://ecampus.dcccd.edu and follow the login procedures to access the course. Use your seven-digit student I.D. number as both the username and password. For more information, contact Clarice McCoy at clariceMccoy@dcccd.edu or 972-860-4166.

class.title: Digital Imaging I
class.description: ARTC 1302 is a beginning Photoshop course and is taught online. Course orientation is online within the course files. Requires access to the Internet using a current browser (not AOL or MSN), e-mail and current version of Adobe Photoshop for your operating system (PC or Mac). Questions? Contact Lauri Collins at 972-860-4308, e-mail LCollins@dcccd.edu or visit Web site: http://telecollege.dcccd.edu.

class.title: Illustration Techniques I
class.description: ARTC 1321 is an advanced Macintosh computer class and will focus on advanced and creative aspects of Adobe Illustrator software. Prerequisite: GRPH 1359 or instructor approval is required. Questions? Contact Jerry Hill at 972-860-4606 or e-mail jhHill@dcccd.edu.

class.title: Digital Imaging II
class.description: ARTC 2305 is an advanced Photoshop course, focusing on more technical and creative aspects of Adobe Photoshop software and is taught online. class.title: Publication Design
class.description: ARTC 2333 is a Macintosh computer class and will focus on the creative development, design and production of multi-paged documents using Adobe Photoshop and InDesign software. The primary project is developing and producing a hand-made book. Instructor approval is required. Questions? Call Lauri Collins at 972-860-4308 or e-mail LCollins@dcccd.edu.

class.title: Art Appreciation
class.description: The May Term Art Appreciation courses will be taught as a combination of slide lectures and hands-on art activities.

class.title: Survey Art History
class.description: This course covers the history of Western Art from Prehistoric time through the Gothic period. It explores the cultural, geophysical and personal influences on art styles.
class.alt-description: This course covers the history of Western Art from Prehistoric time through the Gothic period. It explores the cultural, geophysical and personal influences on art styles.

class.title: 2D Design
class.description: Basic concepts of design with two-dimensional materials are explored. The use of line, color, illusion of space or mass, texture, shape and size in composition is considered.
class.alt-description: Basic concepts of design with two-dimensional materials are explored. The use of line, color, illusion of space or mass, texture, shape and size in composition is considered.

course.title: Advanced Design
course.description: This course will focus on two- or three-dimensional projects in a special topics area.

class.description: This course will focus on two- or three-dimensional projects in a special topics area.

class.title: Advanced Metals/Jewelry I
class.description: This fast-track class will blur the line between jewelry and sculpture, incorporating precious metal clay, found objects, alternative materials and cold connections.
class.alt-description: This fast-track class will blur the line between jewelry and sculpture, incorporating precious metal clay, found objects, alternative materials and cold connections.

class.title: Advanced Digital Art I
class.description: New Genres in Digital Art: Seattle artist Cat Clifford will lead a seminar in New Genres. Using digital video, sound and hand-drawn animation each student will thoroughly document a space of their choosing. These explorations will result in a video portrait of the student's chosen space. Students will be encouraged to explore innovative and experimental approaches to these nontraditional media and processes.

class.title: Biology for Science Majors I
class.alt-description: Biology 1406 is a course for students majoring and/or minoring in Biology or related disciplines. It is recommended that students have recently had either high school biology or Biology 1408 or 1409. It is also recommended that students have recently had high school chemistry or Chemistry 1405 before taking this course.

class.description: The intermediate self defense course utilizes the Northern and Southern styles of Shaolin-Kung-Fu method to teach advanced self defense techniques. Both mental and physical aspects of the arts are stressed. Uniform required and will be discussed at the first class.

class.title: Introduction to Philosophy
class.description: PHIL 1301-2425 requires access to a computer, the Internet and e-mail. MANDATORY orientation online starts June 4 at http://ecampus.dcccd.edu or e-mail Richard Jones at rwjones@dcccd.edu. For registration and information visit http://dallastelecollege.dcccd.edu
class.alt-description: MANDATORY orientation online starts June 4 at http://ecampus.dcccd.edu or e-mail Richard Jones at rwjones@dcccd.edu.

class.title: Photo Digital Imaging II
class.description: PHTC 2349 is a Macintosh computer class and will focus on more advanced and creative aspects of Adobe Photoshop software as it pertains to photography. The basics of digital photography will be presented. A digital camera is strongly recommended. Prerequisite: ARTC 1302 or instructor approval is required. Questions? Call Giraud Polite at 972-860-4215 or e-mail gPolite@dcccd.edu. Classes will meet Monday through Thursday and the first Friday is required.

class.title: Gen Physics
class.description: PHYS 1401 is an algebra/trigonometry based course for pre-dental, pre-pharmacy and pre-architecture majors, and other students who need a two- semester technical course. It is recommended that students take MATH 1414 (College Algebra) and MATH 1316 (Trig) prior to taking PHYS 1401.

class.title: Physical Scien
class.description: Launch model rockets, perform chemical magic and visit Six Flags amusement park as part of this course. STUDENTS MUST HAVE TEXT AND LAB MANUAL FOR FIRST CLASS MEETING. TEXTBOOK INFORMATION IS AVAILABLE IN ROOM K253.
class.alt-description: Launch model rockets, perform chemical magic and visit Six Flags amusement park as part of this course. STUDENTS MUST HAVE TEXT AND LAB MANUAL FOR FIRST CLASS MEETING. TEXTBOOK INFORMATION IS AVAILABLE IN ROOM K253.

class.title: Gen Physics
class.description: PHYS 2425 is a calculus-based physics course designed for physics, chemistry, mathematics and engineering majors. Credit or concurrent enrollment in MATH 2513, Calculus I, is required.
class.alt-description: PHYS 2425 is a calculus-based physics course designed for physics, chemistry, mathematics and engineering majors. Credit or concurrent enrollment in MATH 2513, Calculus I, is required.

class.title: Gen Physics
class.description: PHYS 2425 is a calculus-based course designed for physics, chemistry, mathematics and engineering majors. Credit or concurrent enrollment in MATH 2513, Calculus I, is required.

class.title: Word 2003 Part I
class.description: POFI 1104-2202 is a six-session beginning Word class and will emphasize the basics of Microsoft's word processing program. It includes creating and editing Word documents; naming, saving and printing documents, menu, toolbars and shortcuts; formatting, cutting, copying and pasting text, margins and indents; and inserting graphics and text from other documents and applications. Recommended prerequisite: Windows XP
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2202 is a six-session beginning Word class and will emphasize the basics of Microsoft's word processing program. It includes creating and editing Word documents; naming, saving and printing documents, menu, toolbars and shortcuts; formatting, cutting, copying and pasting text, margins and indents; and inserting graphics and text from other documents and applications. Recommended prerequisite: Windows XP

class.title: Google for Genealogists II
class.description: POFI 1104-2203 is a four-session course in which students learn the Google spreadsheet for chronology reports and Google translate for translating documents in a foreign language. You also will learn how to use Google groups for finding overlooked genealogical information and use more than 4,500 indexed URLs for genealogical research. Recommended prerequisite: Google for Genealogists Part II.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2203 Google For Genealogists Part II is a four-session course in which students learn the Google spreadsheet for chronology reports and Google translate for translating documents in a foreign language. You also will learn how to use Google groups for finding overlooked genealogical information and use more than 4,500 indexed URLs for genealogical research. Recommended prerequisite: Google for Genealogists Part II.

class.title: Internet Part I
class.description: POFI 1104-2204 is a six-session beginning Internet course using Microsoft Internet Explorer, with reference to SBC/Yahoo and AOL. This course will emphasize basic e-mail functions plus attachments, searches using Google and other search engines, addressing Web pages, using instant messenger and discussion groups. You will learn to shop and purchase online and perform other activities at popular Web sites. Recommended prerequisite: Windows XP
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2204 Internet Part I is a six-session beginning Internet course using Microsoft Internet Explorer, with reference to SBC/Yahoo and AOL. This course will emphasize basic e-mail functions plus attachments, searches using Google and other search engines, addressing Web pages, using instant messenger and discussion groups. You will learn to shop and purchase online and perform other activities at popular Web sites. Recommended prerequisite: Windows XP

class.title: Computer Literacy/Basic Skills
class.description: POFI 1104-2205 is designed for the novice who has little or no experience with computers. In this computer literacy course you will practice using the mouse, learn about the components of the computer, including the keyboard and perform rudimentary tasks. After completing this course, you will be ready to enroll in Introduction to Computers/Windows XP.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2205 Computer Literacy/Basic Skills is designed for the novice who has little or no experience with computers. In this computer literacy course you will practice using the mouse, learn about the components of the computer, including the keyboard and perform rudimentary tasks. After completing this course, you will be ready to enroll in Introduction to Computers/Windows XP.

class.title: Digital Cameras
class.description: POFI 1104-2006 is a six-session course that covers the basic operation and features of a digital camera. Students will learn the process of transferring photos to the computer, how to take pictures with an eye for computer enhancement, and how to use photos in e-mails and Web pages. Storage and retrieval of digital photos will be reviewed.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2006 Digital Cameras is a six-session course that covers the basic operation and features of a digital camera. Students will learn the process of transferring photos to the computer, how to take pictures with an eye for computer enhancement, and how to use photos in e-mails and Web pages. Storage and retrieval of digital photos will be reviewed.

class.title: Photoshop Elements Part I
class.description: POFI 1104-2207 is a six-session course to help you import, organize and enhance your photos. Using the Photoshop Elements software you will develop skills in cropping, rotating, resizing, straightening and red eye removal. Recommended prerequisites: Windows XP and Beginning Internet.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2207 Photoshop Elements Part I is a six-session course to help you import, organize and enhance your photos. Using the Photoshop Elements software you will develop skills in cropping, rotating, resizing, straightening and red eye removal. Recommended prerequisites: Windows XP and Beginning Internet.

class.title: Windows Xp/Com Basic
class.description: POFI 1204 Introduction to Computers and Windows XP focuses on computer literacy and terminology of the Microsoft Windows XP operating system. Components of personal computers, hardware and software will be taught as well as menu bars, toolbars and shortcuts. You will learn to name, save, locate and print files and also use the word processing program to create, edit and format files.
